text: Facing issues with conditional server side rendering for one of our experiences on HubSpot CMS with HubL (Website pages)
On start pages (2 different landing pages) we are setting a cookie and on consecutive pages (common pages) based on the cookie we are grabbing stuff from HubDB to render.
However it looks like pages are cached, no matter what pages we start with, it ends up grabbing the same cookie.
the website pages or landing pages are cached?
Website pages (right now its on content staging)
could you link me to the page?
Contact number in the nav is supposed to change based on the cookie

Is there a way to add classes to nested elements within the {% header %} hubl tag? I am trying to add `extra_classes` to an H4 but it only applies the class to the parent <span> that HubSpot adds. Here is my code:
```
{% header "headline"
header_tag="h4", 
value="value",
overrideable=True,
extra_classes="subheadline txt-orange"
%}```
I found a workaround in my css to grab the right element.
its gonna make for some crazy css :slightly_smiling_face:
